title: Cryo-Electron Tomography and Sub-Tomogram Averaging of Respiratory Syncytial Virus Structural Proteins from Native Virions
content: Respiratory syncytial virus (RSV) is a negative-strand (-) RNA virus that assembles into filamentous, enveloped virions [1, 2]. RSV generally causes mild cold-like symptoms but can result in serious illness especially in infants and older adults. Vaccines and prophylactic monoclonal antibody treatment are available, but the improvement and development of additional therapeutics is still needed. A better understanding of RSV virion structure and assembly would aid significantly in these efforts.
